articles.author: Mike Stone, Marisa Taylor
articles.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX and two partners have emerged as frontrunners to win a crucial part of President Donald Trump's "Golden Dome" missile defense shield, six people familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Musk's SpaceX is frontrunner to build Trump's Golden Dome missile shield

articles.author: Anna Hirtenstein, Alexander Marrow
articles.description: Canned food maker Glavprodukt, which was seized in October and is the only American-owned firm to be taken under state control, has been caught in the crosshairs.
articles.title: Exclusive: Moscow plans to use seized US-owned company to feed Russian army, document shows

articles.author: Feras Dalatey, Joanna Plucinska, Reade Levinson, Maha Dahan
articles.description: As his enemies closed in on Damascus, Bashar al-Assad, who ruled over Syria with an iron fist for 24 years, used a private jet to spirit away cash, valuables and confidential documents mapping the corporate web behind his wealth.
articles.title: Operation Assad: the air mission to smuggle the Syrian despot's valuables

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: Scientists see long-term negative impacts on a tradition of partnerships between the government and university researchers dating back to World War Two.
articles.title: Science caught in crossfire of Trump's fight with universities

articles.author: Josh Smith, John Geddie
articles.description: The tens of thousands of U.S. troops stationed in South Korea and Japan appear set to be part of President Donald Trump's tariff negotiations, despite efforts by both countries to separate security talks from trade.
articles.title: Trump includes U.S. troop costs in tariff talks with Asian allies

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: Top Ukrainian officials made a previously unannounced visit to Paris.
articles.title: Europeans, Ukrainians to make their case as Rubio and Witkoff visit Paris

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al-Thani arrived in Moscow on Thursday, Russian state news agency TASS reported, for a visit that will include talks with President Vladimir Putin on Ukraine and Middle East issues.
articles.title: Qatari Emir arrives in Moscow to meet Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The UN nuclear watchdog should play a role in nuclear talks between Tehran and Washington, International Atomic Energy Agency chief Rafael Grossi said on Thursday, ahead of a second round of talks between the U.S. and Iran.
articles.title: UN nuclear watchdog says it should be involved in Iran, US nuclear talks

articles.author: Angelo Amante
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump plays host on Thursday to Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, a close ally who wants to act as a power broker between Washington and Europe amid tensions over U.S tariffs.
articles.title: Trump, Italian Prime Minister Meloni to address US-Europe tariff tensions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two joint Somali-U.S. airstrikes killed 12 al Shabaab militants in central Somalia and destroyed a ship carrying weapons for the al Qaeda-linked group, the Somali government said on Thursday, following recent advances by the Islamists.
articles.title: US-Somali airstrikes kill al Shabaab militants, hit weapons ship, government says
